topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5556366563687245eac50f00#post_5556366563687245eac50f00
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5556356763687221fa770800#post_5556356763687221fa770800
WoW remains a highly profitable game, Guild Wars 2 has been going strong for several years now, costumes work OK in less RPG focused games Like MOBAs but an actual MMO can sell you lots of things, new areas to explore XP boosts, stuff you can't really sell in a full competitive multi player game,[/bq]
I don't mean as in they're not profitable, rather having costumes that players can buy justifies continuing to develop for the game in much the same way that WoW subscription justifies continuing to add stuff in without needing a subscription service.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55563acb63687247b9f01c00#post_55563acb63687247b9f01c00
but allot of games involve getting gear, which people want to see equipped, so the only answers in an MMO is pay to win by buying the best costume/Gear, also remember that you still need to buy expansions for GW2 and it has optional purchases,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55563be16368722f1df24400#post_55563be16368722f1df24400
The problem with the pay to win model is a paradox when it comes to attracting gamers; on the one hand it helps pay for the game without needing a subscription, on the other hand it massively alienates your core demographic.

Call me crazy, but I think Tera Online's system, while experimental, is still smart.  You can either have a subscription, or you can buy the costumes in steam workshop as dlc or you can buy the individual costumes in the store, but it's not pay to win.  (Now if only they could fix the problem with griefers) [don't even bother with trying to buy the costumes with in game currency cause they're all like 99999 gold]
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55563d966368726be2110900#post_55563d966368726be2110900
Again though most players want the gear to show that they earned it,
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55563ea56368726be2a70a00#post_55563ea56368726be2a70a00
I think we can all agree on something though: thank god the EA model of dlc/pay to play when it comes to video games in general didn't work out in the end.
